item.title: Gold Prices Temper After Sharp Rise
item.description: Base metals prices were largely rangebound, while gold prices fell back after having risen sharply as demand for safe-haven assets boosted by the conflict in Israel.

item.title: Telia Lifts Guidance on Earnings Beat
item.description: Telia upgraded its Ebitda outlook after it posted a 9.5% rise in underlying earnings in the third quarter as its telecoms business offset weakness in television and media.

item.title: Fed's Powell Speech Could Lift Dollar Further
item.description: The dollar traded steady in early trade, and it could get another boost from a speech later by Jerome Powell on the economic outlook, DZ Bank Research said.

item.title: SAP Shares Surge After Cloud Business Fuels Revenue Growth
item.description: SAP shares jumped after the German group posted higher revenue and operating profit for the third quarter, led by growth at its core cloud business..

item.title: Pernod Ricard Sales Fall in Soft Start to Year
item.description: Pernod Ricard reported an 8% drop in first-quarter sales as American and Chinese consumers were drinking less, but said it expected to deliver sales growth in the fiscal year.

item.title: Roche Keeps Muted Outlook as Sales Fall
item.description: Roche reiterated its financial outlook for 2023 after it reported a 6% fall in revenue for the first nine months, with growth in its pharmaceutical division overshadowed by a sharp drop in diagnostics sales due to weaker Covid-19-related demand.

item.title: Bond Yields Rise in Eurozone, Heavy Issuance Ahead
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields rose and Commerzbank Research said markets “remained heavy with long-end yields leading the way higher, 10-year Treasurys reaching the 2007 yield-highs and EGB spreads widening across the board.”

item.title: TSMC's Profit Fell on Weaker Demand for Smartphones, High-Speed Computing
item.description: The world’s largest contract chip maker said third-quarter net profit declined 25% from a year earlier, though it projected stronger revenue in the current quarter.

item.title: Nokia to Cut Thousands of Jobs as Profit Plummets
item.description: Nokia launched a plan to cut as many as 14,000 jobs as it seeks to save up to €1.2 billion after it posted a 45% fall in profit in the third quarter.

item.title: DNB Launches Buyback as Profit Rises
item.description: DNB reported a third-quarter profit beat, though the net interest income of NOK15.7 billion was just shy of views, and said it would start a buyback comprising up to 1% of its shares.

item.title: Pro Take: Making Medicines Greener
item.description: Pharma companies are taking steps to become more sustainable, but the real challenge lies in reducing emissions in decentralized, energy-intensive supply chains.

item.title: Renault Reiterates Views as Revenue Rises
item.description: Renault confirmed its guidance for 2023 after reporting an above-forecast revenue for the third quarter, and said it expected second-half group operating margin to be greater than the 7.6% achieved in the first half.

item.title: Nordea Backs Guidance
item.description: Nordea said it still expected return on equity above 15% in 2023 after it posted third-quarter earnings just above views, as net interest margins continued to improve and corporate lending grew.

item.title: Merck Sees Return to Sales Growth in 2024
item.description: Germany’s Merck said it expected to return to organic sales growth next year after a broadly flat performance in 2023, helped by reduced Covid-19 headwinds and recovering demand for semiconductor materials.

item.title: Nestle 3Q Real Internal Growth Points to Improving Volumes, Citi Says
item.description: Nestle’s real internal growth in the third quarter showed a sequential underlying improvement in volume trends, Citi said, adding the RIG consensus miss was small, and “should leave 2023 consensus expectations pretty much unchanged.”

item.title: Nestle Reports Sales Miss
item.description: Nestle’s organic sales rose by a less-than-expected 7.8% in the first nine months driven by price increases as inflation remained high, but backed its full-year outlook.

item.title: Bank of Japan Raises Economic Assessment for Six of Nine Regions
item.description: Japan’s central bank raised its economic assessment for six of the nation’s nine regions, including the Tokyo area.

item.title: U.S. Lifts Broad Sanctions Against Venezuela for Six Months
item.description: The shift comes after the Venezuelan regime and the opposition reach a deal that could lead to presidential elections in 2024.

item.title: Bank of Korea Stands Pat Again as Economy Shows Signs of Cooling
item.description: South Korea’s central bank stood pat on interest rates, as the economy shows signs of cooling while uncertainty in the Middle East grows.

item.title: A group in the Netherlands sued Amazon on Wednesday over its alleged practice of tracking website visitors' online activity.
item.description: A group in the Netherlands sued Amazon on Wednesday over its alleged practice of tracking website visitors’ online activity.
